required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Trancutaneous Abdominal Stimulation on Bowel Function.
clinical_study.official_title: The Effects of Transcutaneous Abdominal Stimulation on Bowel Function in Persons With Spinal Cord Injury and in Able-bodied Persons With Chronic Constipation.

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective, single-center, feasibility study to determine the sensations elicited by non-invasive abdominal electrical stimulation and its effects on bowel function in spinal cord injured individuals and in able-bodied persons with chronic constipation. Electrical stimulation will be delivered through commercially available equipment to each subject during a single site visit.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a prospective, single-center, treatment feasibility study to determine the efficacy of electrical stimulation for bowel functions. The study will determine sensations elicited by non-invasive, transcutaneous abdominal electrical stimulation and its effects on bowel function in spinal cord injured individuals and in able-bodied persons with chronic constipation. The electrical stimulation will be delivered through commercially available equipment to each subject during a single site visit. Visits are anticipated to be no more than 5 hours.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Subjects will be assigned to 1 of 2 groups. The first subject group will include spinal cord injured persons presenting with constipation, the second group - able-bodied persons with chronic constipation. In both groups, subjects will receive transcutaneous abdominal electrical stimulation that will be delivered through commercially available equipment.

primary_outcome.measure: Duration of the occurrence of first stool
primary_outcome.description: The time between the onset of transcutaneous abdominal electrical stimulation and the first stool will be measured.
The time (duration) to complete total defecation following the stimulation.

arm_group.description: Persons living with spinal cord injury presenting with constipation due to neurogenic bowel dysfunction.

intervention.intervention_name: Non-invasive, surface electrical stimulation device, DS5 Digitimer
intervention.description: Transcutaneous abdominal electrical stimulation will be delivered through the commercially available equipment, a DS5 Digitimer.
